info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 4:28PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Richmond and southwestern Aiken Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Augusta Regional Airport, or 10 miles southeast of Augusta, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Aiken, Aiken Mall, Clearwater, New Ellenton, Jackson, USC Aiken, Citizens Park, Gloverville, Augusta Regional Airport, Graniteville, Burnettown, Audubon`s Silver Bluff Sanctuary, Hopeland Gardens, New Savannah Bluff Lock & Dam Park, Savannah River Site Badge Office, Westover, Bennock Mill, Phinizy Swamp Nature Park, Redcliffe Plantation State Historic Site and Boyd Pond Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 10 and 15. Interstate 520 in South Carolina near mile marker 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for east central Georgia...and central South Carolina.
